Content.Content:
[$BOX] [$CELL] [$BLOCK]

Selegiline is a monoamine oxidase inhibitor (MAOI) and interacts with many other drugs, including other antidepressants. The combination of MAOIs with other agents (including SSRIs such as escitalopram) can lead to life-threatening adverse reactions. For this reason, when an MAOI is to be replaced with a different medication, two weeks must elapse between the discontinuation of the MAOI and the initiation of the new medication.

[$/BLOCK] [$/CELL] [$/BOX]
Content.Name: PHYSIOLOGICAL INTEGRITY 704
